column6: The Inspector is sent to prison having been mistaken for a bank robber who looks exactly like him. He soon realizes that his backfiring attempts to escape adds even more years to his sentence.
column7: Sgt. Deux-Deux and the Commissioner do not appear.

column6: The Inspector is continually outwitted by a crow that steals jewels.
column7: Sgt. Deux-Deux and the Commissioner do not appear.

column6: Sent to Canada on an exchange programme, the Inspector is sent after Two-Faced Harry, who has an innocent face on his front and an evil face on his back.
Through his own mistake, the Inspector is stranded on a deserted island with burly convict Mack Le Truck, who is trying to kill him.
column7: Sgt. Deux-Deux and the Commissioner do not appear.

column6: On holiday in Canada as a Mountie, the Inspector is kidnapped by the diminutive but aggressive fur trapper Caribou Lou.
column7: Sgt. Deux-Deux and the Commissioner do not appear.
